definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things

sentences.english: Field day in said that so calculate you borrow a down, after his owing on the loan.
sentences.chinese: 田天在又说那这样吧算你借个首付，以后自己还贷。

sentences.english: The real estate agency says if I pay a 20% down payment, I can move in at once.
sentences.chinese: 房产商说如果我首付20%房款就可以马上人住。

sentences.english: You need to know how to use money form other sources to buy real estate with nothing down.
sentences.chinese: 你必须知道从其它地方搞钱，以实现零首付。

sentences.english: This is the kind of property you should consider for your Nothing Down investment strategy .
sentences.chinese: 我们的零首付理论就是研究这样的房地产。

sentences.english: But in the meantime I thought perhaps you could choose one or two volumes for a down payment.
sentences.chinese: 在这当儿我想你不妨挑一两本书作为我的首付款。

sentences.english: It has also raised the minimum down payment for second-home acquisitions.
sentences.chinese: 也提出了购买第二套住房的了最低首付款。

sentences.english: Thank you for reading the latest edition of Nothing Down.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你阅读最新版本的《零首付》。

sentences.english: When my kids buy a house, they won't just need a down payment.
sentences.chinese: 当我的孩子买房时，他们不仅仅需要首付款。

sentences.english: Ms. Bond had used $38,000 of it as a down payment on a house.
sentences.chinese: 邦德女士用了其中的38，000美元作为房子首付。

sentences.english: Credit may be cheap, but 30% down-payments are standard.
sentences.chinese: 信用可以便宜，但30%的首付，是标准的。

sentences.english: Celeste asked for the money as a down payment on an old farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 西莱斯特索要那笔钱用作一座旧农舍的首付款。

sentences.english: These included higher downpayments for buyers of second homes.
sentences.chinese: 这些政策包括提高购买二套住房的首付比例。

sentences.english: In fact, zero pays is the establishment, in overdraws above the foundation which in the future will expend.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，零首付是建立在透支未来消费的基础之上。

definition: a mortgage (loanword via Cantonese)/to buy property on a mortgage
to buy a house on a mortgage/house mortgage
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
forward delivery apartment/unfinished housing to be paid for in advance by the buyer and then completed within certain time frame
second-hand house/house acquired indirectly through a middle-man
rent for a room or house
